medical_history.chief_complaint: Numbness and pain in the legs and a rash.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 2 years prior, with numbness initially on the left leg, ankle, and foot, followed by similar symptoms in the right leg. About 3 months later, pain developed in the left foot, then in the right foot, leading to diffuse pain in both lower legs over 9 months. Acute swelling in the distal left leg occurred after an airplane trip one year before presentation, which subsided in 2 weeks. Mottled discoloration appeared on the feet, ankles, and lower legs 6 to 8 months prior, with intermittent swelling.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Mild hypertension for 10 years, and ruptured appendix with peritonitis 15 years earlier.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with Sjögren’s syndrome, autoimmune hepatitis, and interstitial lung disease; father with elderly neuropathy; older sister reported to have vasculitis; maternal relative with a history of Sjögren’s syndrome.
medical_history.social_history: Works as a consultant, drinks alcohol socially, does not smoke.
